page.title: 03FENCE THIS CENTURY
page.content: Sam Clegg has lived in Fence all his life. He is 80 years old.he says that there were plays,concerts and dances held in the church school which most people enjoyed.800 people lived in the village.The schools were St.Annes which closed in 1974 and the Methodist school.They started school at 5a.m.43 men died in World War 1.For transport they had horse -drawn carts and traps.There were no buses.You had to walk to Nelson which took 30-35 minutes.There were pubs the Swan Hotel,Forest Hotel and the Harpers Inn.Most village people worked in the village mill called Proctors which made cotton.Also people worked in town.The shops were a drapers,post office and mixed,butchers and groceries but villages went into Nelson.There was a village policeman. {
